snippet: The pace of the killing has slowed sharply since a cease-fire in August, the monitors said, with only 47 civilians killed and 131 injured in the three months ending in mid-November.
abstract: United Nations monitors report at least 9,115 people have been killed in eastern Ukraine in 21 months since hostilities began in April 2014.
lead_paragraph: The pace of the killing has slowed sharply since a cease-fire in August, the monitors said, with only 47 civilians killed and 131 injured in the three months ending in mid-November.

headline.main: At Least 9,115 Killed in Ukraine Conflict, U.N. Says
headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Europe; Ukraine: More Than 9,100 People Killed Since Outbreak of Hostilities, U.N. Says

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
